intro: Mitolepis, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe, characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or golden flowers. The plants typically have hairy stems and leaves, and they produce small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Mitolepis species are often found in rocky or dry habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
